<!--AUTOGENERATED_START-->

## corr \{#corr\}

Introduced in: v1.1

Calculates the [Pearson correlation coefficient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_correlation_coefficient):

$$
\frac{\Sigma{(x - \bar{x})(y - \bar{y})}}{\sqrt{\Sigma{(x - \bar{x})^2} * \Sigma{(y - \bar{y})^2}}}
$$

<br />

:::note
This function uses a numerically unstable algorithm. If you need [numerical stability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_stability) in calculations, use the [`corrStable`](../reference/corrStable.md) function. It is slower but provides a more accurate result.
:::

**Syntax**

```sql
corr(x, y)
```

**인수**

- `x` — 첫 번째 변수. [`(U)Int*`](/sql-reference/data-types/int-uint) 또는 [`Float*`](/sql-reference/data-types/float)
- `y` — 두 번째 변수. [`(U)Int*`](/sql-reference/data-types/int-uint) 또는 [`Float*`](/sql-reference/data-types/float)

**Returned value**

Returns the Pearson correlation coefficient. [`Float64`](/sql-reference/data-types/float)

**Examples**

**Basic correlation calculation**

```sql title=Query
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS series;
CREATE TABLE series
(
    i UInt32,
    x_value Float64,
    y_value Float64
)
ENGINE = Memory;
INSERT INTO series(i, x_value, y_value) VALUES (1, 5.6, -4.4),(2, -9.6, 3),(3, -1.3, -4),(4, 5.3, 9.7),(5, 4.4, 0.037),(6, -8.6, -7.8),(7, 5.1, 9.3),(8, 7.9, -3.6),(9, -8.2, 0.62),(10, -3, 7.3);

SELECT corr(x_value, y_value)
FROM series
```

```response title=Response
┌─corr(x_value, y_value)─┐
│     0.1730265755453256 │
└────────────────────────┘
```

<!--AUTOGENERATED_END-->
